item.title: 3I/ATLAS - Wikipedia 3I/ATLAS, also known as C/2025 N1 (ATLAS) and previously as A11pl3Z, is an interstellar comet[18][19] discovered on 1 July 2025 by the Asteroid Terrestrial-impact Last Alert System (ATLAS) station. The comet follows an unbound, hyperbolic trajectory past the Sun,[5][d] and pass
item.description:
3I/ATLAS - Wikipedia 3I/ATLAS, also known as C/2025 N1 (ATLAS) and previously as A11pl3Z, is an interstellar comet[18][19] discovered on 1 July 2025 by the Asteroid Terrestrial-impact Last Alert System (ATLAS) station. The comet follows an unbound, hyperbolic trajectory past the Sun,[5][d] and passed by Earth at 1.8 AU, posing no threat.[20] The prefix "3I" designates it as the third confirmed interstellar object passing through the Solar System, after 1I/Ê»Oumuamua and 2I/Borisov.[21]
https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:3I-ATLAS_noirlab2532b.jpg https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/f/f1/3I-ATLAS_noirlab2532b.jpg
International Gemini Observatory/NOIRLab/NSF/AURA/B. BolinImage Processing: J. Miller & M. Rodriguez (International Gemini Observatory/NSF NOIRLab), T.A. Rector (University of Alaska Anchorage/NSF NOIRLab), M. Zamani (NSF NOIRLab), CC BY 4.0 https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0, via Wikimedia Commons
https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:3I-ATLAS_noirlab2525b_crop.png https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/1/10/3I-ATLAS_noirlab2525b_crop.png
By International Gemini Observatory/NOIRLab/NSF/AURA/Shadow the Scientist, CC BY 4.0 https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0 https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=174444353https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/3I/ATLAS
